{"step_by_step_thinking": "Migratory motor complexes (MMCs) are rhythmic contractions that occur in the gastrointestinal tract. These contractions help to move food and waste through the digestive system. The intervals between MMCs can vary depending on the location in the gut. In the small intestine, MMCs typically reappear after intervals of approximately 90 minutes. Therefore, the correct answer is B. 90 minutes.", "answer_choice": "B"}
